intro: Pentaschistis fibrosa, commonly known as the fibrous pentaschistis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, bright yellow flowers. The plant has fibrous stems and leaves that are typically alternate and ovate in shape. It is native to regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
